markdownRemark.html: Program errors are intended to express unexpected events during the carrying out of a set of instructions. To a computer, at the lowest level, an instruction could be take these binary values (inputs), perform a logical operation, and generate a new binary value (output). In this idealised model there is not really much unexpected that could happen — if we do not consider events outside of the computers control, like the power socket being yanked out.
